question_text: What is the function of the key notches on DDR memory modules?
answer_options: They help maintain proper electrical grounding
They ensure modules are installed in the correct orientation and generation-specific slots
They enable ECC functionality on supported modules
correct_answer: They ensure modules are installed in the correct orientation and generation-specific slots
explanation: Each DDR version has key notches in specific positions to prevent incorrect installation and ensure compatibility with supported motherboards.
